item.title: Ongoing outsiders parking issue due to broken car park gate lock for over an year now, 7th September
item.description:
A local mechanic has dumped his car here causing issues for resident to park when they come home late at night. Vehicle doesnâ€™t belong to any of the residents from estate can this car be removed please.

item.title: Unfinished roadworks, 7th September
item.description:
Bromley council appear to have got bored half way through building a new crossing. There is now a huge hole all across one side of the road where cables have been laid and no warning to drivers. This has been like this for around a month with no sign of anyone finishing off the job.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Brackley Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very poor road surface, 7th September
item.description:
The road surface of Brecknock Road is extremely poor. I live in a second floor flat on Brecknock Road and the front rooms of my flat (which look out over Brecknock Road) shake when large vehicles (lorries, buses etc) drive past. It is very disruptive to the enjoyment of my flat. I moved into my flat at the start of 2025 and the problem has been getting worse. Please re-surface the road as it is very poor quality and I believe this is what causes my flat to shake.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 159, Brecknock Road, Archway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Advertising placards placed on the Fish Roundabout.Erith, 7th September
item.description:
Advertising Placards are distracting & obscuring driver's vision while approaching this traffic island - Why are they there ? There is hardly any lamp post that is free of some sort of signage in the Bexley & Erith area. Please do something about it & let those wonderful patriotic flags remain.to remind us who we are & that we are sick of the governmental bureaucrats that are now ruining our lives !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
